isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built After June 2, 2002 - disassemble - ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD

svcsubproc.title: Disassembly of Anchor Plate Components

warning.para: Safety glasses should be worn at all times when assembling or disassembling.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Disassembly Of Anchor Plate Components

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 41
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: With the anchor plate and splash shield (Items 1 and 2) removed and placed on a clean work surface, remove brake pad abutment slippers (Item 6) using a blunt nose drift or screwdriver and a light hammer. Avoid marring anchor plate abutment surfaces of anchor plate (Item 1).
On front and rear axles with 66 mm disc brakes, remove 12-point head bolt plugs (Item 3) from anchor plate tie bar mounting holes of the anchor plate (Item 1).

Remove guide pins and guide pin boots (Items 4 and 5) by pulling guide pin out of anchor plate (Item 1) with a slight twisting motion. The guide pin boot (Item 3, Figure 42)
will pull off the anchor plate boot groove (Item 4, Figure 42) . Remove guide pin boots from guide pins.

note.para: If the guide pins (Item 4) are frozen in the anchor plate (Item 1), use a blunt nose drift through the threaded hole of the 12-point head bolt plug (Item 3) in line with guide pin and carefully drive the guide pin out of the anchor plate guide pin bore.

figure.caption: Figure 42. Remove Guide Pins and Guide Pin Boots from Anchor Plate

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If so equipped, remove ABS sensor bracket (Item 1) from anchor plate (Item 2) by removing two 12-point head bolts (Item 3), driver side front and rear shown.
Remove splash shield (Item 4) from anchor plate (Item 2) by removing three 12-point head bolts (Item 5), driver side front and rear shown.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remove ABS Sensor Bracket and Splash Shield from Anchor Plate

step1.para:
Once the anchor plate and splash shield has been disassembled, refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Clean and Inspect
to clean and inspect and rebuild the anchor plate and splash shield.
